author: papanito
body:
Registering of a private powershell gallery fails with `'SourceLocation' is an invalid Web Uri.` even so the URI seems correct and corresponds to the one provided by my Nexus3 server.

- I have direct access so no proxy
- Changing the url from https to http gives the same error
- I can successfully browse the repository

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Register-PSRepository -Name TestRepo -SourceLocation https://nexus3/repository/nuget-group -PublishLocation https://nexus3/repository/nuget-psgallery/ -PackageManagementProvider nuget -InstallationPolicy Trusted
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
PS Repository is registered successfully

Actual behavior
---------------
Error is thrown
```powershell
Register-PSRepository : The specified Uri 'https://nexus3/repository/nuget-group' for parameter
'SourceLocation' is an invalid Web Uri. Please ensure that it meets the Web Uri requirements.
At line:1 char:1
+ Register-PSRepository -Name TestRepo -SourceLocation https://nexus ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (https://nexus..ory/nuget-group:String) [Register-PSRepository], Arg
   umentException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvalidWebUri,Register-PSRepository
```

----------------
```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.14393.1884
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}

PowerShellGet            1.0.0.1          PackageManagementProvider, Type, Scope, AllowClobber, SkipPublisherCheck, ...
Programs                 3.0.0.0          IncludeWindowsInstaller, IncludeSystemComponent

```

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
@iSazonov I'm not sure what help I can be. The PowerShellGet module and Register-PSRepository don't use the Web Cmdlets. It directly calls to either System.Net.Http.HttpClient or System.Net.WebRequest. the InvalidWebUri error is thrown for a bunch fo different reason in that module. 

Only thing I can suggest to @papanito  is to use the server's FQDN instead of just `https://nexus3/`. But I'm no expert on this module.

comments.author: rebro-msft
comments.body:
I believe this issue is already being tracked in PowerShellGet repo: [Issue 180](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellGet/issues/180)
And has a [ Stack Overflow post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35296482/invalid-web-uri-error-on-register-psrepository).

I'm not familiar with nexus repository, so not sure if the following applies to your scenario.  But when I saw something similar (registering a debug session of PowerShell Gallery locally) it was complaining because the SSL cert used by HTTPS was not in the Trusted Root.  When I fixed that, the issue resolved.

Another workaround is to  I registered the http endpoint, then edit the repositories xml file to use the https endpoint instead.
